meanings.definition: The failure of an organ or system to maintain adequate function.
meanings.sent1: After the decompensation of his heart, he needed urgent medical attention.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained that decompensation of the liver can lead to serious health issues.
meanings.sent3: The decompensation of the air conditioner on a hot day left everyone sweating.
meanings.sent4: The decompensation of the engine caused the car to come to a sudden stop.
meanings.sent5: The decompensation of the computer system resulted in a complete shutdown of operations.

meanings.definition: The inability to cope with stress or adapt to changing circumstances.
meanings.sent1: Her decompensation during the exam led to a panic attack.
meanings.sent2: The therapist helped him manage his decompensation in social situations.
meanings.sent3: His decompensation over losing a game of chess was quite dramatic.
meanings.sent4: The decompensation in the office was evident when deadlines were missed.
meanings.sent5: The decompensation in her behavior was noticeable during times of high pressure.
